conclusion: To solve the problem, interpret the image to understand the layout of the baffles connected to containers D and E, and determine which container the liquid is most likely to flow into.

Liquid is flowing out from points A, B, and C.
The image shows baffles connected to each source of liquid, directing the flow towards one of the containers at the bottom.
The liquid from A flows directly into D through the baffle.
The liquid from B flows through a baffle that appears to lead towards E, but there is also a connection from B to D via another baffle.
The liquid from C seems to be directed towards E.
Liquid from A clearly goes to D. Liquid from B appears to have a path to D as well, while liquid from C is directed towards E.

Given the connections, liquid from B and C predominantly flows into E, but since liquid from A directly goes to D and B also has a path to D, it is likely that D will receive the majority flow after passing through baffles.
